Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2010 07:47AM Lovegolf wrote: I had DCIS and after lumpectomy 4 of 5 margin were still DCIS.  I decided to hve bilateral Mx.  When the final path report came back there were other areas of DCIS that had not shown up on mamo or MRI(which was scary).  It is tough decision and is very personal.  Ask questions, get 2nd opinion, talk to women here and your friends and family. AS far as time off goes I did not have reconstruction.  I went to a conference for work two weeks or after Mx...I probably should not have but no one could tell otherwise.  I was back working in my home office with 3 -4 days and at office when back from conference.  I would get tired around 3:00-3:30pm  When I was home would get 45 min. nap traded nap for expresso when back at work.  You will go along for weeks and then just one day be tired.  I also pushed liquids to move all the meds out of my system. Breathe  My Bilat Mx was 5/1/09 and I am doing great.  Found a yoga program at the fitness center that is part of medical center and it has been great. Hang in there.  If you have direct question you can PM me.
Posts.Title: When Margins Aren't Clear MSHH patoo

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2011 07:17AM Lovegolf wrote: ASk to see a pain doctor. I had a cream compounded that I rub where it hurts and within 20 minutes no pain. Plus I do not have the effects of pain pills, sleepy etc. I had the feeling like a hot wire across my chest and now I can make it go away with this cream/paste.
Posts.Title: Nerve Pain post BMX with Axillary Dissection Question HollyinMich dannade

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2011 06:31PM Lovegolf wrote: There is cream that is Rx and made at compounding Rx. I have some and will post the mixture later...not with me now.  Also i found yoga helps.
Posts.Title: Pain continuing after 2 years carolson55 Lovegolf

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 04:41PM Lovegolf wrote: Breathe...Pure DCIS can be treate many ways. They may next order a MRI.(the dye sometimes give one a bad headache after so be wafre. Drinks lots of fluids.)  Your surgeon will be able to give you information on how close to chest wall and what type of margins could be obtained. Write down your question in a notebook and carry it with you. Also under the DCIS thread here you can find alot. Beetsie write so much about it and is very knows so much. This is the worst part the waiting. It will get better when you know the plan.  Hang in there. you can PM me any direct questions

You will find you and are stronger than you ever knew .

I will be glad to answer.
Posts.Title: How do you know if Mastectomy is right for me? vanlex the7gerbers

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2010 05:46PM Lovegolf wrote: DivaJMusic Everyone here is right...it does get better. Just wanted to pass on experience with MRI.  I had mine and then went out shopping.  I got a headache that came on me fast...dizzy burred vision...I am told it might have been from the dye.  So drink lots of fluid after to push it through your body..and do not plan on driving in case this happens to you.  Hang in there you will get to other side of this
Posts.Title: tough weekend DivaJMusic chrissyc

Posts.Content: May 10, 2011 09:26AM Lovegolf wrote: I had not heard from my brother or his family since right before BMX. One of my nephews called to see if he could come visit on spring break. I told them about the cancer and my surgery then. I had not heard from them since then 2 years ago. Then I get an email from nephew through his mother's email account asking for money for his football team. I thought I hear nothing for two years not a call, text email and now you want money.  No thanks
Posts.Title: Some family has not even asked how mastectomy went! Fearless_One PaulaLS

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2012 10:08AM Lovegolf wrote: Yeah I wish I had taken them on a farewell tour ...flashed at all my best drinking places etcc.  Would have had t-shirt made like rock tours with places and dates...sold shirt for non-profit....Also on path report for Mx it read "nipples unremarkabke"  Damn I thought for 47 years they were better than that....

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2011 10:35AM Lovegolf wrote: Sending postive thoughts your way
Posts.Title: New... Jennt28 patty9999

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2010 01:41PM Lovegolf wrote: The nuclear med part does not hurt really.  It is marking the nodes.  I did not have reconstruction so can not help there.  I think there maybe more pain from that.  I will say that you will be sleeping on your back awhile.  Some women find a wedge pillow helps,  I got many medium soft pillows and built a nest.  It help to have soft pillows next to both sides of my body. Also make an appointment at a salon to just get your hair washed a day or two after you are home.  I could not wash mine and found that just getting clean hair made me feel better.  Get a couple of big oversied button up shirts to wear or zip front sweatshirts.   The drains are just uncomfortable and in the way.  I found I could pin them to the inside of shirt.  You will have to drain them and measure fluid. move things you use/need to lower shelf in kitchen since reaching up may hurt.  That's must of the little things I can recall. Best of luck
Posts.Title: Wondering what to expect faith22 Lovegolf

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2011 11:36AM Lovegolf wrote: Yeah it can be fast but then I was always a rip the band-aid off fast kind to girl. I tell people I have breast cancer for 2 weeks. Had lump. 4/20 and Bilat Mx w/o reconstruction 5/1/09. I remember just saying GET IT OUT OF ME. I understand the move fast.  Breathe....It maybe  marthon not a dash.
Posts.Title: New... Jennt28 patty9999

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2009 11:40AM Lovegolf wrote: Yeah the spanx should do good....there is something like that at Victoria secrets. Target is good too. I found some that are part spandex part cotton.  They are the best. Might want to look at dancewear too. I wore a cami for weeks 3-4. I slept in undershirt for 2 months. I would pull the drains under the shirt and pin them at the collar/neck of the shirt. After am right drain came out i still had fluid build up and for 4-5 weeks had to be drained every week with needle.  I did not fell it, but it did keep the area swelling after every stick.  BE VERY CAREFUL putting heat.  I thought that would make the draining stop, but after awhile, since I could not feel the skin I got bad burn.
Posts.Title: Need help with drain/compression dressing cwrightrn cwrightrn

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 07:14PM Lovegolf wrote: I wore home made fake one last night for the 1st time since right after BMX. No one could tell....I have now started working out and dropped 45 pounds. I did feel like w/o boobs my stomach wwassa bigger.  As for getting use to the how you look..everyday it is better. I look at my chest and see scar of my warr against cancer, but I know I won. The scars make me appreciate the victory.

I got a call that day with the results so I hope you can too.
Posts.Title: Bone Scan in 3 days margodae margodae

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2010 04:08PM Lovegolf wrote: As for the MRI get the valium if you think you will need it.  I closed my eyes and walked every golf course i know. ..a friend of mine sang X-mas songs to yourself.  Think of what you and where you will go ahead of time.  Also I got a bad headache after MRI...from the contract.  Drink fluids to push that out faster. If your job is not too physical after the surgery you should be good in few days.  After lumpectomy, on Friday, I was back at office on Monday. Hang in there...
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed/Surgery MissTW Lovegolf

Good luck with operation drop bomb.....
Posts.Title: telling my mother cookiegal cookiegal

Posts.Content: May 24, 2009 10:43AM Lovegolf wrote: Hey  I have gotten emails that say there is push for insurance co. to make Mx day surgery.  There is bill before Congress to require atleast 2 days to be covered by insurance.  I have written my Congressman Joh Barrow, who is supporting requiring up to 2 days to be covered.  Pass this along
Posts.Title: Bilateral mx and professional conference MI_Runner Lovegolf

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2010 10:24AM Lovegolf wrote: You will need help as everyone has said.  Cook a few things ahead. Make an appointment 2 or 3 days after you get home to to hair salon and just get your hair washed and dried. It does not seem like much, but it will make you feel better. It is hard to ask for help but for awhile you are going to need some....just think of this way if a friend of yours was going through this would you take a meal over? So accept the help and acknowledge to yourself you will pay it forward when others are sick.
Posts.Title: going at it alone? migallen migallen

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2012 04:55PM Lovegolf wrote: I started seeing a personal trainer to help with upper body muscle ....he has helped so much
Posts.Title: Muscle tone for the flat-chested nibbana coraleliz

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2012 01:38PM Lovegolf wrote: yeah...I saw a personal trainer who would help target my upper body.  I also found it better and that I was more likely to go and stay with it if I had a trainer.  My trainer has been great. He understands how I felt ...he has an artifical leg. So when I get to feeling sorry for myself or like I want to quit I look at him and go on. I have been with him since Dec 2011. I could only barely lift a 2 pound hand weight ..now I up to over 40 pound. Have lost weight and really toned up. I do not think my chest has changed that much as how it looks...put with weight dropping and arms etc looking better I feel better. I notice I walk more upright.

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2009 07:37PM Lovegolf wrote: Lisa Hope it goes well. It is the waiting the is so hard.
Posts.Title: Having excisional biopsy in 16 hours coffeelatte communicationb

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2011 09:28AM Lovegolf wrote: I had bilat mx 5/1/09 and could type right away. BUT you will get tired. It is odd how little pain there is. Sleeping on your back can be hard to get use to..Get lots of soft pillows and build a nest. I only took pain Rx at night after 2 days, I also learned you will want to get an appointment to get your hair washed a few days after you are home.  It is hard to do so in shower etc but just having clean hair 3 days after Mx was so good.  As the nerves re-connect they can fell like hot wire on chest. It was worse in cold weather.  I went out of town to a conference 15 days after Mx....I really should not have done it, but no one could talk me out of it.  I get hit a wall abut 4 weeks of so out. Just tired, but I think I pushed too hard early. I found 3pm naps great and then had to replace them with 3pm expresso when back at office. Check with the medical center were you going...some have fitness centers. Local one here has free yoga classes for cancer patients. It helped with keeping my chest from tighting up.  If you have other question you can PM me.
Posts.Title: BMX w/o Reconstruction and Typing anonymice anonymice

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2011 11:28AM Lovegolf wrote: I too had DCIS close to the chest wall. Had BMX 5/1/09 no reconstruction. I did not have to have chemo or radiation. 2years + out I am going great. Breathe the first part of this is the worst...waiting. Once you have a "fight plan" and know what you have to do and timeframe to do it it will feel better. My path report postop showed DCIS in locations not found on mammo or MRI.  You will find you are stronger than you know..it will change you though. I started 2 list during this; 1 was 100 things I want to do in my life and when I do one & add another. So there is always 100 things. 2rd list was moments in my life that took my breath away/were just perfect. That put thing in a different light for me. You will ge to the other side of this

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2009 06:33PM Lovegolf wrote: I hope you get good news 9/22..the waiting sucks...As for visiting your old friend MJ, whatever gets through. I had a friend once say she knew was grown up when she started putting her pot in Waterfold crystal....

Posts.Title: Heidi Update-it isn't pretty Heidi_Ho zeeka71

Posts.Content: May 18, 2009 11:33PM Lovegolf wrote: I had bilateral 5/1 and am at first real business thing since then..today I worn a cup formed bra that I had cut one layer of fabric out of and stuffed....it look good but it was only comfortable for about 5hours.   I have found that realy soft mens or womens no sleeves undershirts are the best....I can wear these undershirt with crisp button front shirts and it is OK.  It feels good and with a blazer or jacket no one can really tell...when the skin heals more I may try something else,  but for now healing and feeling good is more important.  I must say today even when I was wearing just undershirt and shirt with blazer people who had not seen me for a year had no idea....Hope this helps
Posts.Title: Bilateral mx and professional conference MI_Runner Lovegolf

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2012 04:25PM Lovegolf wrote: Another tip..make an appointment a day or after you get home to get your hair washed. It may not sound like much, but you will not feel like doing so and your arms really will not feel like working over your head....plus you will have drains.  I could clean myself up but funky hair so not going to cut it. Big button up shirts zip up hoodie. Ask for help. That can be hard, but you do not need to be carrying anything. Also get lots of soft pillows so you can build a nest around you in the bed. If you can rest your arms on soft pillows and not down against you it will feel better.   Breathe when in doubt long so breath.  Also go ahead and think os a place you can go in your head walk a beach you know, sign songs to yourself, whatever..but have a place planned to go in your head when it get scary..When you are having your nodes marked whenever. I wlked every golf course I know in my head, but it was calming.  Find that place for you.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed and scared kfontaine bluepearl

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2013 11:31AM Lovegolf wrote: It is Gaba 4% Keta ao% and lido 6% this is % that works for me
Posts.Title: Phantom Itching txmomof2 Jennie93

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2009 12:45PM Lovegolf wrote: Cathi I understand. I wanted to get back normal ASAP. I too made the choice to have bilat MX.  Many people here do the same and I do not think regret it.  I knew if had another lumpectomy and they did not get clear margins I would feel like the wind was knocked out me.  I also did not want to live with the worry of IT coming back.  I was only in hospital ovenight. I wanted to go home the next morning.  I figured I was use to the germs in my house but the hospital had all kind of things...plus i knew I would sleep better at home. As for recovery....I drove myself to a seminar out of town two weeks after MX.  I should not have done that...I pushed myself the first two years and by week 3 hit the wall. Of course no one could have told me any different.  Depending on what type of work you do, you can get back in 2 -3 weeks part-time.  I was lucky and could work at home and have work brought home to me.  you will have drains in when you go home.  I found the best way to deal with them to be to wear tank top / undershirt and run them under that shirt, pin the drains to the piping around the neck, then have a couple a big oversized button-up shirt to go over that.  If you have any specific questions, you can send me private message and I will be glad to help. You will find you are stronger than you ever knew.
Posts.Title: Sept 10 2009 Cathicam Cathicam

Posts.Title: 100 things never to say to a woman who has had a mastectomy: iwannabefree jillyG

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2013 03:50PM Lovegolf wrote: Breathe when in doubt breathe some more...the beginning is the worst. I think the not knowing what you will have to do weighs heavy. Take notes at the appointments. Write down questions as you go. When you know what your "fight plan" will be it will be easier. I am almost 5 years out. I will say you will need give yourself permission to ask for help some as you go along. Be kind to yourself. Find a good friend, who can talk you off the ledge and who will not be too emotional in dealing with YOUR cancer. After my surgeries I found a yoga group for all cancer survivors that helped so much.

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2010 10:54AM Lovegolf wrote: I am playing when it is not so hot.  I started back 4 -6 months have surgery but it took awhile to really take a good full swing.  My swing changed and I had to get use to it but am so glad I can play.  That was when i felt like things were getting back to normal.  The yoga the past few weeks has been great.  I am looking to add extra classes into my week. Go to a driving range with say a 8 iron and just swing a little. I also have a putting green in my yard andd started putting within weeks of surgery,
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: May 25, 2009 05:24PM Lovegolf wrote: Geena As you can see everyone is different. I had bilat Mx 5/1 I was home in my bed the next morning.  I did not have reconstruction and really did not have pain after.  You will want to make plans to go a salon to get your hair washed.  I never thought clean hair would feel so good.  Also Dr. would not let me drive until drains out so you will need drivers...even if just for an outing.  Sounds like you are covering all the bases...Best of luck. You will find you are stronger than you ever knew...You are taking steps to beat this and be in control of your life...When you wake up think CANCER GONE.
Posts.Title: I LIVE ALONE - post bi lat mast help? wabiwoman Jeansbeans

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2010 12:03PM - edited Mar 1, 2010 12:03PM by Lovegolf I saw a PS who I have known for years who works with injury reconstruction.  He does not do breast reconstrction.   He went in and trimmed the extra skin, did lypo under my arms, along top ribs, and took out some area of nerve damaged tissue that was acting like a trigger point for so much of the pain.  If you want any other details you can PM me
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2010 11:19AM Lovegolf wrote: I went to my first yoga class last.  The fitness center at the medical center has free classes for all cancer paitents and survivors>  It was great.  I am going to try to caught one class a week, two if work allows.  I can see this helping so much with range of motion, etc.
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2011 10:22PM Lovegolf wrote: I understand i have posted here and other places. I had the hot wire across my chest. It started below scar and over 2 years has moved up to above scar. PS tell me in 3 year it will be gone. She helped me find pain Dr who compounded cream to go right where pain is. I can not tell you how much it helps. Ask for compounded pain Rx. It does not go through your body to make sleepy etc. It is good for about 6 hours then re-apply. Some doctors do not know the lastest in Rx that can be compounded.
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2011 10:00AM Lovegolf wrote: I think it has helped with PM pain
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2013 01:08PM Lovegolf wrote: I found yoga and a special Rx pain cream to be the best for that hot wire across the chest pain.
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2013 10:56AM Lovegolf wrote: I had iron bra and that hot piece of wire feeling.  I got a compounded cream from doctor...it had gabapin, ketamin & lidocaine.  It has great. I could put it where it hurt and it worked..plus it was not a pill that made me sleepy. It has to be made at a compounding Rx.  Ask your Dr.  I can post the % of each if that will help.
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2010 11:24AM Lovegolf wrote: Hello ladies I had bilat Mx 5/1/09 and had PMPS.  It was the hot wire across my chest feeling.  My surgeon was great about it and talked to me. I had no reconstruction.  On 10/28 a great PS went in and did magic. I had developed a real hot point that triggered alot of pain.  PS revised the scar and removed extra tissue etc.  I feel great no more pain.  The hot wire is gone. I sleep on either side with no pain. I rolled over in the bed with out pain or waking up. PMPS is very real.
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2010 12:16PM Lovegolf wrote: Ladies I am pleased to say the this past Sat. I was able to play golf and it did not hurt.  After the 10/28/09 I have been pain free and the hot wire is gone!!! I feel like my life is back.  Just wanted you to know it is possible.
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2010 10:33AM Lovegolf wrote: elivel did help the most of anything pill wise....It acts on nerve endings and did make it easier to sleep .
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2012 09:07AM Lovegolf wrote: Route went from Broughton st down Whitaker turn before Park , Habersham to State, state back to Barnard & in front of Jepson.....it was great...weather perfect. Downtown with the squares and flowers in bloom is so pretty.  No protestors.
Posts.Title: 3 years!!!! Lovegolf SelenaWolf

Posts.Content: Lovegolf wrote: Dear all   Today is my 3 year birthday. This also the weekend of the 5K Komen here. I an carrying the survivor flag during the walk. I wanted to post here for those of you just getting diagnosed.  It is a scarey time. Breathe. Since I have been on these boards I have followed many others fights. I am carrying the names of my board friends with me tomorrow. Also with me will be my mother in-law who survives for 43 years. So as you come here in the beginning know you can fight, win, live, survive and thrive! Dx 4/20/2009, DCIS, 2cm, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 3 years!!!! Lovegolf SelenaWolf

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2010 10:59AM Lovegolf wrote: HI ladies I had lots of pain after bilat Mx with no reconstruction.  I did get relief from a revision type surgery by a PS.  I have started yoga this past month.  It is great.  The medical center has a fitness center that give free classes twice a week for all cancer survivors and patients.  It is great.  If you have a chance to try this I would recomend it.  Many centers do such classes, it is yoga with training wheels, but helps with pain, mind & body.
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2011 02:50PM Lovegolf wrote: Yeah the beginning is the worst. Breathe. It does get better when you know what the plan is to fight it. Ask questions, get copies of all your test reports.  It sucks and shock at first rocks your world.
Posts.Title: Very confused and scared maggiestatas AnnieBear

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2009 02:22PM - edited Jul 2, 2009 02:23PM by Lovegolf I had bilateral MX 5/1 with no recontruction.  I am glad I made that choice.  This is your choice and your path.  You are stronger than you know and you will get through it.  I saw this on another site..hope it helps  Cancer Cannot Do Cancer is so limited . . . It cannot cripple Love. It cannot shatter Hope. It cannot corrode Faith. It cannot destroy Peace. It cannot kill Friendship. It cannot suppress Memories. It cannot silence Courage. It cannot invade the Soul. . It cannot conquer the Spirit. It will not conquer you.
Posts.Title: Help, IDC, Surgery Tomorrow Mamamari spar2

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2012 01:04PM Lovegolf wrote: I started working out with a trainer 12/9/11. I could only lift 2lbs over my head...and now over 25lbs. I am training to 3 day 60 mile walk in the fall. Also have found yoga to be great. Ask your doctors for PT and seek out a trainer who will listen to what you have gone through and work with you
